posts.post_content: I would have been delighted to see this in my pool during the prerelease. Alas, I had only 2 guildgates and 15 basic lands. On the bright side, all of my spells were very splashable, and I even had two hybrid cards. There was a game where I drew nothing but Islands and Plains and was able to stick a [Deathcult Rogue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathcult Rogue) with [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of  Orzhova). It did feel weird, playing Dimir as if it were Azorius.

Posted By: DacenOctavio (1/28/2013 6:26:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is actually in terms of virtual card advantage the same as [divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=divination).  
You Cast (-1 cards)  
Get card on board (+1 card)  
Draw a card (+1 card)  
Total: +1  
  
Divination:  
You Cast (-1)  
Draw 2 cards (+2)  
Total (+1)  
  
Think of this like [elvish visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=elvish visionary), but, instead of getting a [willow elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=willow elf), you get [mana cylix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mana cylix). This card is boss. Just put it in a deck, geeze. Generally this kind of effect wouldn't be worth a card, but, it's not a card, it's just straight value. In other words, play it in every limited deck, and in commander.
posts.html:

You Cast (-1 cards)
Get card on board (+1 card)
Draw a card (+1 card)
Total: +1

Divination:
You Cast (-1)
Draw 2 cards (+2)
Total (+1)

Think of this like elvish visionary, but, instead of getting a willow elf, you get mana cylix. This card is boss. Just put it in a deck, geeze. Generally this kind of effect wouldn't be worth a card, but, it's not a card, it's just straight value. In other words, play it in every limited deck, and in commander.

Posted By: Ligerman30 (2/1/2013 11:32:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: When I look at this card, I see a Sorcery speed 'Think Once' (if you will) that turns one of my lands into a 5-color land each turn. Although it's clearly less powerful than say [Chromatic Lantern](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chromatic Lantern), this card could potentially be more useful than the lantern in many cases. Firstly, It's one less mana to cast. While it's not a mana source on its own and it doesn't ramp, unlike [Chromatic Lantern](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chromatic Lantern), it *does* replace itself in your hand and thin out your deck. This is a good card if you'd rather fix your mana for the rest of the game rather than spending 3 more mana to [Think Twice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Think Twice), or if you'd rather thin down your deck on Turn 2 instead of ramping on Turn 3. I also think it's important to note that unlike [Transguild Promenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Transguild Promenade), Prophetic Prism does not take up your land-drop. Maybe that's a good thing and maybe it's not, depending on the nature of your deck. I'm well aware that the Sorcery speed c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Opeth2010 (8/19/2013 5:22:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've certainly considered an artifact combo-deck based around lowering costs with [Etherium Sculpter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculpter) and [semblance anvil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=semblance anvil), then lots of low cost cantrip artifacts. Flicker effects work on this too by the way; so [Ghostly Flicker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostly Flicker) becomes a [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift) cantrip when you only need to save 1 guy.  
  
Not sure what the wincon is yet, but if you can tutor almost anything while gaining card advantage there's usually a way to produce easy mana, then you just name the win con of your choice; probably storm.
posts.html:

Posted By: GhostCounselor (3/13/2013 11:29:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of the best artifacts ever.  
Nets you cards to compensate, is pretty cheap, and transmutes mana.  
This is especially good if you're running a [Nightveil Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightveil Specter), anything with Extort, or are short on a color.  
I run four of these in my Orzhov deck, as its a good thing to get out early if you get mana screwed, but if you draw one later, it is pretty cheap, and leaves room for extort.
